meanings.definition: The cast-off outer covering of an animal, such as a shell or skin.
meanings.sent1: The exuvium of the crab was left behind on the shore.
meanings.sent2: She found the exuvium of a snake in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The exuvium of the beetle made a tiny hat for a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The exuvium of the cicada clung to the tree like a fragile memory.
meanings.sent5: The exuvium of the lobster was as empty as a forgotten dream.

meanings.sent1: After molting, the lizard's exuvium was lying on the rock.
meanings.sent2: The exuvium of the insect was delicate and transparent.
meanings.sent3: The exuvium of the crab became a cozy bed for a tiny hermit crab.
meanings.sent4: The exuvium of the snake shimmered in the sunlight like a discarded jewel.
meanings.sent5: The exuvium of the butterfly was a reminder of its transformation.
